explanation:
OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET - This macro is used at the top of the function and will expand into project code (possibly invoking helper functions or table lookups). It must be inspected because a memcmp usage comparing nul-terminated strings could be hidden inside the macro expansion.

OS_ObjectIndexFromToken - The call graph shows this helper is the likely implementation behind OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET. Its implementation must be checked for any use of memcmp (or other string comparisons) operating on nul-terminated strings.

OS_impl_filehandle_table - The object/table passed to OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET; its structure or accessors might contain code (or inline helpers) that perform string comparisons using memcmp. Inspecting the table declaration/usage rules out that possibility.

OS_impl_file_internal_record_t - The target function reads/writes fields of this type (impl->fd, impl->selectable). The type definition and any inline accessor functions/macros should be checked for memcmp usage.

OS_DEBUG - The logging macro/function used when open() fails could expand to project code that compares strings (e.g. for formatting or filtering) and might use memcmp; inspect its definition/expansion for forbidden memcmp-on-strings.

strerror - Although a standard library function, its use here produces strings; include it to document whether the project wraps/implements its own strerror replacement that might use memcmp. If the project-provided strerror is used, it must be inspected.

open - The POSIX open call is used with the local_path argument; include it to check for any project wrappers or inline shims around open that could perform string comparisons using memcmp. If open is the system call (no project wrapper), it can be ignored for MISRA violation, but the wrapper must be confirmed.
